hume
Interface ILearningObsolete

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleReenforcementLearningObsolete
public interface ILearningObsolete

Interface for the learning algorithm that agents use to update the variables that control their behaviour, i.e. the variables localTrustworthiness, marketTrustworthiness, localTrust, maketTrust.

Any concrete learning algorithm must implement this interface. Implementors of this interface may implement some methods of this interface with merely an empty method body. This would be suitable if the learning algorithm does not allow to draw conclusions in all possible cases. (For example, in a particular learning algorithm it may not be intended to adjust any of the agents' variables if the agent "stayed at home".)

STATUS: complete, but no implementing classes so far a remaining problem is that there is no information regarding why an agent stayed at home. Should this information matter for learning?

Author:
eckhart

Method Detail

learnStayedAtHome

void learnStayedAtHome(Agent agent,
                       TrustGame trustGame)
Draws conclusions (i.e. adjusts its variables) for the agent agent, if it decided to stay at home.

Parameters:
agent - the agent that (potentially) learns something
trustGame - the trust game the agent would have played if it did not stay at home

learnRewardAsCustomer

void learnRewardAsCustomer(Agent agent,
                           Agent other,
                           TrustGame game)
Draws conclusions (i.e. adjusts its variables) for the agent agent, if it was rewarded in the role of the customer by the agent other.

Parameters:
agent - the agent for which learning takes place
other - the supplier that rewarded the agent
game - the trust game that the agents played

learnRewardAsSupplier

void learnRewardAsSupplier(Agent agent,
                           Agent other,
                           TrustGame game)
Draws conclusions (i.e. adjusts its variables) for the agent agent, if it rewarded in the role of the supplier by the agent other.

Parameters:
agent - the agent for which learning takes place
other - the customer that was rewarded by the agent
game - the game that the agents played
